movie_title: Plastic waste eaten by enzymes ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Plastics can be difficult to recycle - could a recently discovered enzyme help? Neil and Beth discus

vocabulary.definition: tiny particles of plastic, typically less than 5mm in size
vocabulary.example: The ocean is filled with microparticles of plastic, harming marine life.
The waste management company decided to incinerate the plastic waste to reduce its volume.

vocabulary.definition: easily broken or cracked under pressure
vocabulary.example: The brittle plastic toy shattered into pieces when it fell on the ground.

vocabulary.definition: a recycling process that results in the production of lower quality products
vocabulary.example: Unfortunately, most plastic recycling methods lead to downcycling rather than true recycling.

vocabulary.definition: biological molecules that act as catalysts to speed up chemical reactions
vocabulary.example: The enzyme in the stomach helps in breaking down food into simpler substances for digestion.
The new technology shows great promise in revolutionizing the way we recycle plastic.
